title: "Life isn't kind, but Hell sure isn't either."
body:
I stood there with a smile etched into my face.

I had won, society would never be a pain. No longer would I be surrounded by imbeciles.

My intelligence was dying every damn second of this god awful life.

And then I jumped off the chair, my decision final.

The sweet nectar of release would grasp me any moment.

Instead I find myself dangling for what seems to be hours on end.

"Why isn't this working?" I bemoaned.

And then I saw the metallic shimmer of a blade in the corner.

Death.

It spoke raspily, and sounded as if it were breathing in at the same time.

" Your time has not come yet. "

It was in full view now, showing all of its grotesque glory. It wasn't like your normal fairy tale version.

It was far more terrifying than that.

A 6 foot naked man now stood with broken wings spread out, each feather a peppered black and white, and many were torn apart from the wear of countless ages. The scythe looked crafted from elm, as if a branch was torn off. The blade was not hammered on, instead nestled in a weave of bark.

The face was what drained me of color.

Its eyes were sewn closed perfectly, almost as if they were never there in the first place.

A maw sat there in place of a mouth. It looked as if someone had cut into a pumpkin. The teeth were almost as sharp as the makeshift lips, and melded into the black void.

To top it off was long, pure white hair.

I wanted to scream, but instead found myself still in awe of what I now face.

" Life isn't kind, but Hell sure isn't either. "

It then continued on, " Too many waste their lives, their intelligence, just for the sake of "freedom". Life is precious after all. "

I scoffed, "What would you know about life?"

"Better than you I suppose", he laughed.

Death had knocked at my door, only to let me down. Why was I more important than someone else?

" You will be the one to show the world the light, the truthfulness of death. You are the artist, the world your brush. This change will be your masterpiece. "

"Why was I chosen as your artist?" I cried out.

Tears now streamed down my face. Society was a burden strapped to my shoulders. It was something I could never escape even if I tried. Now Death had denied me my last beacon of hope.

" Do not cry my sweet child. My reasoning will be revealed in due time.Only then will you begin to comprehend the true nature of this."

And then he was gone. Only a stray feather now lay where he once was.

The ceiling crashed down on me like His words did me, yet I still emerged unscathed.

I now lay there. Dust and brick were splattered against my blue button-up. MyÂ  orange tie now appeared a grey mess, but managed to meld into the shirt like His teeth did mouth.

I couldn't comprehend any of it, I was petrified. Yet a strange smile grew from beneath my tear-laden eyes.

I couldn't die.

I am the one that will purge society of its imbeciles.

The world will be reborn.

And then I collapsed.
author: demonattacker
